title: Josh Warrington tells fans to have ‘passports ready’ after second-round knockout of Sofiane Takoucht
text:
Warrington made short work of Takoucht (Pictures: Reuters)

A fired-up Josh Warrington sent a message to his doubters after taking less than two rounds to stop Sofiane Takoucht.

The Leeds fighter defended his IBF featherweight title in front of his hometown fans, knocking down the French challenge twice before the referee stopped the contest in the second.

The knockout was just the seventh of Warrington’s 30-fight career, but was a timely reminder of his power as he chases a unification clash in 2020.

Questions about Warrington’s punching power had clearly irked the champion, as he sought out the camera seconds after stopping Takoucht to send a message to his doubters.

WHAT. A. PERFORMANCE! 🙌 Josh Warrington blows the roof off the First Direct Arena by stopping Takoucht in the second round! Absolutely relentless 🔥#WarringtonTakoucht pic.twitter.com/PgLZQo6HLh — Boxing on BT Sport 🥊 (@BTSportBoxing) October 12, 2019

‘People say I can’t punch?’ Warrington said, before shrugging his shoulders.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Warrington made it clear before the fight he was unhappy with his opponent, bemoaning a failed attempt to make a unification fight with one of the other featherweight champions.

With Leo Santa Cruz and Oscar Valdez moving up in weight and vacating their titles, that leaves WBC holder Gary Russell Jr and WBA (Regular) holder Xu Can as the remaining champions.

‘I have made it very clear I am open to any of them,’ Warrington said after his victory.

‘Gary Russell Jr is kicking about. Shakur Stevenson could be fighting for the WBO title. If Xu Can wants the fight here I am.

Warrington is now targeting a unification fight (Picture: Getty)

‘I am leaving my options open. Everyone has their passports at the ready. In 2020 we are coming for you all.’

Warrington is expected to fight again in early summer of 2020 and Frank Warren has said the team are looking at a return to Elland Road.

But should one of the world champions invite Warrington to America or elsewhere, it is expected the Brit would accept an overseas unification showdown.
